title: Puerto Rico: Citi Microentrepreneurship Award Finalists
summary: San Juan, Puerto Rico - Citi announced the finalists in the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, offered for the first time in Puerto Rico this year. The awards, administered by Fundación Comunitaria de Puerto Rico, are a Citi global initiative that recognizes microfinance institutions, microenterprises and microentrepreneurs that promote economic development in the country holding the award competition.
tag-1: Puerto Rico: Citi Microentrepreneurship Award Finalists
tag-3: San Juan, Puerto Rico – Citi announced the finalists in the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards, offered for the first time in Puerto Rico this year. The awards, administered by Fundación Comunitaria de Puerto Rico, are a Citi global initiative that recognizes microfinance institutions, microenterprises and microentrepreneurs that promote economic development in the country holding the award competition.
tag-4: This year, Puerto Rico joined 35 other countries offering the awards. The competition was created in 2004 as a United Nations project and institutionalized later by the Citi Foundation in a number of countries to acknowledge the efforts of microentrepreneurs around the world.
tag-5: "In Puerto Rico, the Microentrepreneurship Awards recognize the passion and efforts of microentrepreneurs in generating economic activity in their communities, as well as the important role of microfinance institutions and incubators in encouraging the creation of these types of businesses," explained Guillermo Gómez, Citi Country Officer for Puerto Rico.
tag-6: The finalists in the various award categories are as follows:
tag-7: Microfinance Institution - Microfinanzas PR, San Juan - P.E.C.E.S., Humacao - Proyecto Matria, Caguas
tag-8: Emerging Microenterprise - Awesome Yogurt, Vieques - El Café De Andrés, Camuy - Kisses Animal Care, Bayamón - Martin Peña Construction, San Juan - Tu Bizcocho.com, San Juan
tag-9: Established Microenterprise - PR Café Colao, San Juan - Watersports & Ecotours, Humacao - Kiddie Kuts & More, San Juan and Guaynabo
tag-10: "Fundación Comunitaria has been collaborating closely in community economic development for the last 15 years, so when Citi proposed that we be part of the awards, we accepted immediately," said Dr. Nelson I. Colón Tarrats, Executive President of Fundación Comunitaria de Puerto Rico. "We believe in the power of community to stimulate economic development."
tag-11: The finalists were chosen by a selection committee composed of the following individuals, all of them with experience in microenterprise and community economic development: Limaris Aponte, Director of Instituto Empresarial para la Mujer; José Carmona, a reporter covering banking and finance for Caribbean Business; Anitza Cox, President of Fundación de Estudios Técnicos; Yvette Collazo, Director of the U.S. Small Business Administration; Dr. Nelson I. Colón, Executive President of Fundación Comunitaria de Puerto Rico; Enid Flores, President of E² Solutions; Dr. Paul Latortue, Professor of Economics at Puerto Rico University; Javier Rivera Aquino, Director of Junta para la Inversión en la Industria Puertorriqueña; Eduardo Torres, Vice President, Citibank Puerto Rico; Dr. José Vega, Director of the Business and Enterprise Center at the Mayagüez campus of Puerto Rico University; and, as an honorary member, Luis Rodriguez Báez, Q.D.E.P.
tag-12: The winners will be announced at an awards ceremony December 2 at Fraternidad AFDA in San Juan.

tag-15: Fundación Comunitaria de Puerto Rico The FCPR is a non-profit philanthropic organization that for the last 28 years has collaborated with communities in two ways: 1) administration and custody of funds established by individuals, families, corporations and philanthropic groups for community well being; and 2) the design and implementation of programs, awards and recognitions focused on education, economic development and housing in the social interest.
